Package ev3dev.hardware.display

Interface JavaFramebuffer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BitFramebuffer, LinuxFramebuffer, RGBFramebuffer
    public interface JavaFramebuffer
extends java.io.Closeable

    Java2D-based framebuffer interface

    This class provides an interface between BufferedImages and native framebuffers.

    Since:
    2.4.7

      • getStride

        int getStride()
        Query framebuffer scanline stride, e.g. real row length in bytes.
        Returns:
        Screen scanline stride in bytes

      • createCompatibleBuffer

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage createCompatibleBuffer​(int width,
                                                    int height,
                                                    int stride,
                                                    @NonNull
                                                    @lombok.NonNull byte[] backed)
        Create pixel-compatible buffer with a specified size and stride. This buffer will be backed by existing byte array.
        Parameters:
        width - Requested image width.
        height - Requested image height.
        stride - Requested scanline stride.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage with correct settings.
